Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Ahem!

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: (I think it’s starting!)

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Welcome students, to Fairwick School of Witchery!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Each of you, new or returning, have made the best possible choice for your future by attending Fairwick. Before graduation, you will no doubt face many challenges:

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Mastering century-old knowledge dating back to the birth of this world’s magical arts.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Facing fearsome monsters.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: And facing more fearsome final exams!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: But with hard work and determination, I have full confidence that each and every one of you will thrive here.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: I am Principal Richard Jove, and it is my pleasure to welcome you all to Fairwick’s 185-186 school year!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: As the oldest school of magic in the known world, Fairwick bears a legacy of magical innovation and community service.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Some claim that the school has been in decline as of late…

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Phooey!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Our school, and the communities it supports, have never been stronger.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Here, you will learn to use the magical art of potion-making to defend yourselves and your communities against the vicious monsters that roam our world.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Potion making is an honorable profession with a storied history: a history Fairwick is intertwined with.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Few are more connected to that history than our Senior Professor of Potions,  professor Harthemony.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: Welcome, students.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: As Principal Jove said, Fairwick is a school that has fostered excellence in its students for generations.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: As such, I expect excellence from each of you.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: It is my innermost desire, my life’s work, to see all of our students contribute to making Fairwick the greatest school it can be.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: In class, I will push you all very hard.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: I will not push you out of contempt, but out of appreciation for your potential.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: If you can endure the challenges awaiting you in my class, and if you share my love for Fairwick, then please join me in my quest to return our school to its former glory.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: When we, the students and staff of Fairwick are united in pursuit of a common aim, there is nothing we cannot accomplish.

Speaker: Harthemony
Dialogue: I look forward to our time together.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Don’t let Harthemony get to you, everyone. If you need to blow off steam after his class, you can always venture into \b the wilds \w for some ingredient collection.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Fairwick was deliberately constructed near \b the wilds \w — a myriad of natural ecosystems rich in ingredients that can be brewed into potions.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: While all of your professors may assign you on trips off-campus to combat creatures, few are more experienced in monster-hunting than professor Yuvei.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: Hello everyone.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: I’m glad to see so many returning faces.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: After last year, I’m surprised that some of your faces aren’t clawed off.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: I’m looking at you, Amber!

Speaker: Amber
Dialogue: I told you I’d be more careful!

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: Ha, no amount of care could have ripped that thing off of you. You need to get stronger.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: Anyway, as I was saying…

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: More large, highly dangerous monsters have been spotted in the forest this year.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: We don’t know where they’re coming from, or why they’re so big, but they’re here for the foreseeable future. And that means new rules regarding off-campus trips.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: Listen up, because if you don’t, you’re as good as dead!

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: NO going into the forest at night.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: NO going off-campus without a partner.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: and most importantly:

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: Absolutely NO trips up Mount Ruin.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: We’ve been running this place for 185 years without a single student death in the wilds. That’s a track record we will maintain this year.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: If you have a problem with any of these new rules, you have a problem with me.

Speaker: Yuvei
Dialogue: Thanks for listening, let's have a good year out there everyone!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Thank you, professor Yuvei.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Fairwick takes the safety of its students very seriously. Do not disregard these new rules, or the new monsters on school grounds.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Any students who recklessly endanger themselves will be expelled, or worse.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: On a lighter note, professor Flitpaw had their best year ever last year. Their class is growing more rapidly than any other!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Professor, please tell us what has made your class so successful.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: (Is that… a cat?)

Speaker: Flitpaw
Dialogue: Mewo.

Speaker: Floofy
Dialogue: Mewo!

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: (Aww, I think Floofy likes them.)

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Well said, professor Flitpaw. Your succinctness is no doubt one of the reasons you draw in so many students.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: While most rare potion ingredients are found in The Wilds, botany is an essential skill for growing more… garden variety ingredients.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: I’m here all week.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Now, here to tell you more about botany at Fairwick and ingredient growth is professor Ferringway.

Speaker: Ferringway
Dialogue: Hello, students.

Speaker: Ferringway
Dialogue: Botany is a wonderfully complex field which many potions students never fully understand.

Speaker: Ferringway
Dialogue: If you are among the select who value the intricacies of botany, though…

Speaker: Ferringway
Dialogue: I look forward to uncovering the secrets of flora with you.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Thank you, professor.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Last, I am pleased to present our oldest professor, the esteemed professor Iglet, head of fungal research.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Hello, little sprouts!

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Ho ho ho! How jolly it is seeing so many bright eyed new students in the crowd.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Fungus are friendly and helpful! They have been my lifelong companions.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Why sprinkle a little growing potion and…

Speaker: Ferringway
Dialogue: Iglet, that’s disgusting!

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Ho ho ho! Nature is sometimes disgusting.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: But great beauty and merriment can be found in disgusting places.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Though it is small and reliant on other creatures for sustenance, the humble fungus nourishes the soil.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: In the same way, it has rooted itself in my heart and nourished the soil of my spirit.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: It has also rooted itself in my stomach! I think you will find many fungi are quite tasty, ho ho ho!

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: I cannot wait to see you all grow into an ecosystem of young pupils, learning lessons not only from me, but from your peers and the magical world around you.

Speaker: Iglet
Dialogue: Now if you’ll excuse me, I need to find this little bobbins a home!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Mmm, he is a strange one, that Iglet.

Speaker: Ferringway
Dialogue: He doesn’t know how to do real research.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Well, he is tenured, so he is here to stay.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Thank you so much, students, for getting to know our faculty.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: We look forward to a wonderful year getting to know all of you.

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: And with that, let me be the first to officially welcome you as students of Fairwick School of Witchery!

Speaker: Jove
Dialogue: Have a wonderful evening, everyone. Sleep well, classes begin tomorrow!

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: What an interesting bunch.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: It’s getting late, I should find my new \b dorm room \w.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Let’s go Floofy, It’s almost bedtime.

Speaker: Floofy
Dialogue: Rawrrrrr.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: We can explore the campus tomorrow, Let’s get to our room. It looks like it’s upstairs in the \b East Wing \w.

Speaker: Floofy
Dialogue: grrrrrrr.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Incredibly, I'm actually the main character.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Oh wow, you must be important!

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Will you help me solve all of my lifes problems?\nI've got a big assignment due soon.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Can I refuse?

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: If you don't want to see the \d\rTrue Ending\w\s.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: darnit

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Hi there! I'm \p.It's nice to meet you.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Oh, sorry. Am I in your way?

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: No, I wanted to say hello! I'm a first year student.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Oh, h-hi! I'm Lidia. How are you liking the campus so far?

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: It's really pretty. It's nothing like where I'm from.

Speaker: Floofy
Dialogue: Mrrrrrowww!

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Right, where we're from. Sorry Floofy.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Woah! Is this your cat?

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Yeah. Floofy and I are inseparable.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Mmm, I see. I had a cat back home too... I miss him.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: It's hard being away from home. Are you a first year too?

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Woah! Maybe we'll have classes together.

Speaker: Lidia
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: I'm gonna look around some more, but let's hang out sometime!

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Believe it or not, I'm the main character.

Speaker: Ginger
Dialogue: No way! I'm a background NPC!

Speaker: Ginger
Dialogue: I have more dialogue in this demo than I will in the final game!

Speaker: Main Character
Dialogue: Believe it or not, I'm actually the main character.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Believe it or not, I-

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Wait what?

Speaker: Main Character
Dialogue: \dI know what you are \b\p\w.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Where's this coming from? Was he this bad last year too or–

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Hi! I'm \p.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: uh, cool? Good for you. Anyway Hero, I really don't think–

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Oh, I wasn't trying to intrude. I'm a first year, and I just came to campus. Do you have any advice for fitting in at Fairwick?

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Uh, no? Can you please leave?

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: Lux, don't be rude. Hi (studentName), I'm Hero. At your service. We're fourth-years.

Speaker: Floofy
Dialogue: M-mroar?

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: (What, these two are a little intimidating!)

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: H-hi? What's Fairwick like?

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Why did you come here? This school blows.

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: Nah, a couple people just blow. I'll get over it.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: If you want some real advice, take Flitpaw's class. They don't take attendance so it's easy credit. Classes are a waste of time.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Shouldn't I go to classes so I can learn potion-making?

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Why? Classes won't actually improve your life. If you want to learn something useful, you're better off exploring the forest. That's what we do.

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: HERO: You can come out with us! We're friends with the school chef. If we find Haverin seeds in the forest he'll make them into Haverin for us.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Hero! I thought that was our thing...

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Haverin?

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: It's an exotic drink. The school imported Haverin seeds into the forest generations ago, though. Back when the school was still prestigious and influential.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Wait, really? Where'd you even learn that?

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: President Gyre's book

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: My.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: GOD.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: You actually read that dusty old thing? I had no idea you were such a nerd, Hero.

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: I'm a nerd, huh? Truffle told me he was teaching you how to process Haverin seeds. Now that is some nerd activity right there.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: That's because I'm addicted, not because I'm interested!

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: Anyway, come see us tonight in the Great Hall after convocation if you want to have Haverin. We'll bring extra potions and show you how to handle yourself out there

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Hero, why are we babysitting the first year? Let's just go together like last year.

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: Come on, Lux! It'll be fun to change things up!

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: uuuugh, okay.

Speaker: Morgan
Dialogue: Yeah! We'll see you tonight if you feel like joining us.

Speaker: Lux
Dialogue: Later, kid.

Speaker: Desmond
Dialogue: Cats are friends, not food!

Speaker: Floofy
Dialogue: Nyaw?

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: Ooooooh, here comes one now.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Hi everybody, what are you all talking about?

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: We were asking Desmond if he eats cats.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Why would he eat cats?

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: ‘Cause he's a vampire bat.

Speaker: Desmond
Dialogue: Actually Big Boy, I'm a pedioid vampire bat. I don't mean anyone any harm

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: So you aren't going to try and suck out my blood?

Speaker: Desmond
Dialogue: Of course not!

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: Darn, that would have been rad.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: My name's \p. I'm a first year. What about you all?

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: I'm a first year too. I like plants.

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: and cats.

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: Desmond is pretty cool too.

Speaker: Big Boy
Dialogue: He'd be cooler if he sucked peoples' blood out.

Speaker: Desmond
Dialogue: I'm Desmond, I'm a first year like Big Boy. It's nice to meet you.

Speaker: Jeremy
Dialogue: I'm Jeremy, a third year.

Speaker: Jeremy
Dialogue: I'm trying to win a seat on Student Council this year. Vote for me!

Speaker: Goth Boy
Dialogue: Hi, I'm Goth Boy.

Speaker: Goth Boy
Dialogue: That's all I have to day.

Speaker: Player
Dialogue: Nice meeting all of you, hope I see you around in classes!
